snippet: The century-old station was retired in 2009, but its $500 million replacement, flooded during Hurricane Sandy, could face years of rebuilding.
abstract: Century-old South Ferry subway station was retired in 2009, but its $500 million replacement, flooded during Hurricane Sandy, could face years of rebuilding; Metropolitan Transit Authority says either old station could be called back into service as temporary replacement, or new station could be brought back in stages, restoring service before full rebuilding is complete.
lead_paragraph: The century-old station was retired in 2009, but its $500 million replacement, flooded during Hurricane Sandy, could face years of rebuilding.

headline.seo: M.T.A. May Reopen Old South Ferry Station Temporarily
headline.main: Retired South Ferry Station May Reopen Temporarily
headline.print_headline: Retired South Ferry Station May Reopen Temporarily
